articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine is ready to sign a mineral resources deal with the United States and could do so later on Wednesday, a Ukrainian government source told Reuters.
articles.title: Kyiv ready to sign resources deal with US, Ukraine government source says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel said it carried out a strike in Syria against extremists who attacked members of the Druze community, following through on a promise to protect the minority group as sectarian violence spread near Damascus on Wednesday.
articles.title: Israel says it hit extremists in Syria to protect Druze

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian drones attacked Ukraine's Black Sea port city of Odesa early on Thursday, killing two people and injuring five more, in addition to sparking fires and damaging infrastructure, the regional governor said.
articles.title: Russian drone attack kills two, injures five in Ukraine's Odesa

articles.author: Joshua McElwee
articles.description: As Catholic cardinals meet to choose a new pope, they will face a big question: Is it time, after three consecutive non-Italian pontiffs, to give the papacy back to the nation that held it for most of the 2,000-year history of the Roman Catholic Church?
articles.title: Will Italy get the papacy back after half a century of foreigners?

articles.author: Shivam Patel, Tanvi Mehta
articles.description: India's foreign minister said he has told Secretary of State Marco Rubio that perpetrators of the deadly attack in Kashmir last week should be brought to justice, as the U.S. sought to calm tensions between nuclear-armed India and Pakistan.
articles.title: India wants Kashmir attackers brought to justice, foreign minister tells Rubio

articles.author: Jun Yong, Bing Lok
articles.description: When 68-year-old Richard Han heads to the ballot box on Saturday to vote in Singapore's election, cost-of-living pressures will be on the retiree's mind as he worries about his daily expenses and his son's prospects after university.
articles.title: Cost of living is a key issue as Singaporeans head to May 3 election

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Trump administration has approached China seeking talks on U.S. President Donald Trump's singling Beijing out for 145% tariffs, said Yuyuan Tantian, a social media account affiliated with Chinese state broadcaster CCTV said on Thursday.
articles.title: US has reached out to China to talk tariffs, state media says

articles.author: Elizabeth Piper
articles.description: Voters across parts of England on Thursday will choose a new lawmaker, mayors and councillors in local elections expected to favour the right-wing populist Reform UK party and deal a blow to Britain's two main parties.
articles.title: English local elections expected to boost populist Reform party

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea's Supreme Court overturned on Thursday an earlier ruling that had cleared election frontrunner Lee Jae-myung of election law violation, throwing into doubt his eligibility to run for the presidency.
articles.title: South Korea top court overturns presidential frontrunner's criminal case

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: Columbia University student Mohsen Mahdawi's release marked a setback for the Trump administration's efforts to deport pro-Palestinian foreign university students, though other students remain in jail.
articles.title: Palestinian student released on bail as he challenges deportation from US
